intro: Neurolaena venturana, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both tropical and subtropical regions. Neurolaena venturana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
